instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Hi, this is liquid damaged. liquid has touch close to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. 

I get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC</SIGNAL> 3.3v, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v.

Ended up replacing both <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. (CD3215C00) and <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> still 5v.

What any other power rails need to be present to get 20v?

Thank you for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Hi thank you for your quick reply.
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> IS 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> IS 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Probably still bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
Compare diode mode readings on power rails for all (4) <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
I get
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> 0.432v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.324 V
PP20V 0.124 V IN DIODE MODE. 
All of them near same reading

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message: any other power rail need to get 20v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Hi just an uodate.

I injected ppbus to F7000 and you get pp20v and cpu vcore. So i changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> still no luck. only 5v on pp20v.also found <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> burnt and replace the cap. I get 3.3v on pin 1. but some time i get 4.5v on <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> pin 1. by thst time <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> goes to 2.3v or 2.7v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
You mentioned correct <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> in the first post.
What happened, that you only get 2.3-2.7V now?
<CHIP>U6903</CHIP> requires enable signal from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips have various power rails, 1V1, 1V8, 3V3, 5V.
Even cannot get voltage on any, you still must check diode mode on all.
Compare readings between the 4 chips and look for any strange value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Hi thank you for your reply.

I got first stage stable 3.3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. then I noticed 2, 3 times it went to 2.3, 2.7 v . now i get 3.3v stable.  I get <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. 
on <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> i get 1.1v on <CAPACITOR>C3204</CAPACITOR> , 1.8v on <CAPACITOR>C3205</CAPACITOR>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and pp3v3)<SIGNAL>UPC_LDO</SIGNAL>. But i dont get 5v in <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL>. do we need s4 stage to get this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message: only 5v ig et is from pp20v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message: I checked the diaode mode values . pretty much same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
As i mentioned when i injected <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  I get pp20v 20v and the CPU vcore. Is this normal   even with bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>? or is this <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> iissue?

As this is 1TB, 16gb board I'm trying anyhow to repair this board. really appriciate your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Hi 2info,

Finllay I fixed this and solved.

I thought to give a note here as the fault is bit strange and hopefuly this will use for some other technician.

I got <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v and diode mode also fine (0.325v)
Some times <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> droped to 2.7v so I injecked 3.3v pp3v3 and i get 20v on pp20v. but  nothing on <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> or <RESISTOR>R6902</RESISTOR>.
 then with out injecking i get 5v on <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> and the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. Finally i found what ever voltage comes to <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> pin 1 & 2 out put is only 3.4v . Replaced <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> solved.

Again Thank you very much for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar PP20V is 5.2v
threads.message:
Glad to hear is solved now.
And thanks for posting the solution.
